medical_history.chief_complaint: Limb weakness and absence of menarche or secondary sex characteristics.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was initially admitted to a local hospital due to limb weakness. After 5 days of potassium supplementation treatment without improvement, she was transferred to the emergency department. Three months after discharge, the patient showed increased levels of blood potassium, estradiol (E2), and 24h-UFC. One year later, she developed regular vaginal bleeding with a menstrual cycle of 28-30 days lasting 5-6 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had no history of menarche or development of secondary sex characteristics.
